methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.settings_version
params.description: The version of instance settings. This is a required field for update method to make sure concurrent updates are handled properly. During update, use the most recent settingsVersion value for this instance and do not try to update this value.

params.name: data.authorized_gae_applications
params.description: The App Engine app IDs that can access this instance. (Deprecated) Applied to First Generation instances only.

params.name: data.tier
params.description: The tier (or machine type) for this instance, for example db-custom-1-3840. WARNING: Changing this restarts the instance.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: This is always sql#settings.

params.name: data.user_labels
params.description: User-provided labels, represented as a dictionary where each label is a single key value pair.

params.name: data.availability_type
params.description: Availability type. Potential values: ZONAL: The instance serves data from only one zone. Outages in that zone affect data accessibility. REGIONAL: The instance can serve data from more than one zone in a region (it is highly available)./ For more information, see Overview of the High Availability Configuration.

params.name: data.pricing_plan
params.description: The pricing plan for this instance. This can be either PER_USE or PACKAGE. Only PER_USE is supported for Second Generation instances.

params.name: data.replication_type
params.description: The type of replication this instance uses. This can be either ASYNCHRONOUS or SYNCHRONOUS. (Deprecated) This property was only applicable to First Generation instances.

params.name: data.storage_auto_resize_limit
params.description: The maximum size to which storage capacity can be automatically increased. The default value is 0, which specifies that there is no limit.

params.name: data.activation_policy
params.description: The activation policy specifies when the instance is activated; it is applicable only when the instance state is RUNNABLE. Valid values: ALWAYS: The instance is on, and remains so even in the absence of connection requests. NEVER: The instance is off; it is not activated, even if a connection request arrives.

params.name: data.ip_configuration
params.description: The settings for IP Management. This allows to enable or disable the instance IP and manage which external networks can connect to the instance. The IPv4 address cannot be disabled for Second Generation instances.

params.name: data.storage_auto_resize
params.description: Configuration to increase storage size automatically. The default value is true.

params.name: data.location_preference
params.description: The location preference settings. This allows the instance to be located as near as possible to either an App Engine app or Compute Engine zone for better performance. App Engine co-location was only applicable to First Generation instances.

params.name: data.database_flags
params.description: The database flags passed to the instance at startup.

params.name: data.data_disk_type
params.description: The type of data disk: PD_SSD (default) or PD_HDD. Not used for First Generation instances.

params.name: data.maintenance_window
params.description: The maintenance window for this instance. This specifies when the instance can be restarted for maintenance purposes.

params.name: data.backup_configuration
params.description: The daily backup configuration for the instance.

params.name: data.database_replication_enabled
params.description: Configuration specific to read replica instances. Indicates whether replication is enabled or not. WARNING: Changing this restarts the instance.

params.name: data.crash_safe_replication_enabled
params.description: Configuration specific to read replica instances. Indicates whether database flags for crash-safe replication are enabled. This property was only applicable to First Generation instances.

params.name: data.data_disk_size_gb
params.description: The size of data disk, in GB. The data disk size minimum is 10GB.

params.name: data.active_directory_config
params.description: Active Directory configuration, relevant only for Cloud SQL for SQL Server.

params.name: data.collation
params.description: The name of server Instance collation.

params.name: data.deny_maintenance_periods
params.description: Deny maintenance periods

params.name: data.insights_config
params.description: Insights configuration, for now relevant only for Postgres.

params.name: data.password_validation_policy
params.description: The local user password validation policy of the instance.

params.name: data.sql_server_audit_config
params.description: SQL Server specific audit configuration.

methods.name: getActivationPolicy
methods.description:
The activation policy specifies when the instance is activated; it is applicable only when the instance state is RUNNABLE. Valid values:

  • ALWAYS: The instance is on, and remains so even in the absence of connection requests.

  • NEVER: The instance is off; it is not activated, even if a connection request arrives.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.sql.v1beta4.Settings.SqlActivationPolicy activation_policy = 10;

methods.name: setActivationPolicy
methods.description:
The activation policy specifies when the instance is activated; it is applicable only when the instance state is RUNNABLE. Valid values:

  • ALWAYS: The instance is on, and remains so even in the absence of connection requests.

  • NEVER: The instance is off; it is not activated, even if a connection request arrives.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.sql.v1beta4.Settings.SqlActivationPolicy activation_policy = 10;

params.name: var
params.description:
The activation policy specifies when the instance is activated; it is applicable only when the instance state is RUNNABLE. Valid values:
